zero.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Make x greater than or equal to zero.
zero.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the point between + and – on a scale for measuring something, or the lowest point on a scale that shows how much there is left of something
zero.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The petrol gauge was already at zero.
zero.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a temperature of 0° on the Celsius or Fahrenheit scale
zero.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: It was five degrees below zero last night.
zero.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: none at all, or the lowest possible amount
zero.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Mike’s chances of winning are virtually zero.
From 1971 to 1976 West Vancouver experienced zero population growth.
zero.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: the number 0. Also used when saying there is nothing at all
A million is written as one followed by six zeros.
Our chances of success are virtually zero.
zero – used especially in the results of sports games
In rural areas, employment opportunities are almost nil.
zero – used in calculations and figures
It has increased by nought point seven five per cent (=0.75%).
used to say the number 0 like the letter O
The code for Oxford is 0 one eight six five (=01865).
zero.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: no growth, inflation etc at all
zero.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Government officials are predicting zero inflation for April.
The figures show zero growth in industrial output value.
zero.translation[2].definitions[2].defin: another name for ZERO COUPON BONDs
